definitions.definition: to cause worry, pain, or difficulty to someone or something over a period of time:
examples: Financial problems have been plaguing their new business partners.

definitions.definition: to annoy someone, especially by asking repeated questions:
examples: The children plagued him with questions all through lunch.

definitions.definition: bubonic plague , or any serious disease that kills many people:
a large number of things that are unpleasant or likely to cause damage:
